member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.LayoutManager
member.summary: This class is responsible for automatically positioning all nodes in the diagram.

remarks.para: You can explicitly re-layout the whole diagram by calling . However, it is more common to let this LayoutManager decide when layouts should happen. You can control this by setting the property on each kind of layout. By default each layout has its set to invalidate its layout whenever a node or a link or a group membership is added or removed, but not when a node changes size. Once a has been invalidated, this LayoutManager will eventually call its method.

Each and has a single that may position the node and route the link. The is found by proceeding up the chain of containing s until it finds one with a value for , or it ultimately uses the diagram's .
The predicate decides whether a particular part should be laid out by a given layout. You can set the attached property to be the string "None" if you do not want it to be laid out.

Automatic layout in GoXam includes support for animated movement of nodes to their intended destinations. Such support is not limited to the execution of -- you can call at any time. For example, the method calls .

Setting the property to false disables all animation. Set the property to control how quickly the animation completes. For nodes that do not have an initial location (because the value is NaN,NaN), you can specify the point from where they appear to come by setting the .

Although this class inherits from FrameworkElement in order to support data binding, it is not really a FrameworkElement or UIElement! Please ignore all of the properties, methods, and events defined by FrameworkElement and UIElement.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.LayoutManager.LayoutDiagram
member.summary: Request a re-layout of all of the nodes and links in this diagram.
member.remarks: This first marks each in the diagram as invalid and then schedules a layout to occur soon.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.LayoutManager.LayoutDiagram(Northwoods.GoXam.LayoutInitial,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Request a re-layout of all invalidated layouts in this diagram.
member.param: If the value is , all s will be declared invalid, and they will all be performed at the time given by the argument. If the value is , s will be declared invalid only if they are responsible for s that do not have a , because their X and/or Y values are Double.NaN. If the value is , all s will be declared valid, and no layout will occur until after something else happens to invalidate a layout. If the value is , no layout validity is changed -- any invalid layouts will be performed at the specified time.
If true this method performs an immediate layout. If false this method schedules a layout to occur soon.
member.remarks: The value for the parameter usually comes from the property. This method changes the validity of layouts by setting the property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.LayoutManager.Initial
member.summary: Gets or sets under what conditions an "initialization" or "reset" of the model should cause layouts to be invalidated.
member.value: The default value is .
member.remarks:
The diagram will call with this value when there has been a significant change to the whole diagram, such as:
the diagram's model's (or other source) has been replaced
one of the diagram's model's "Path..." properties has changed
the diagram's has been replaced
one or more of the diagram's node DataTemplates have been replaced

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.LayoutManager.PerformLayout
member.summary: This method is called asynchronously in order to layout a .

remarks.para: This calls on each low-level that has a , and proceeds up the chains of containing groups until it finally does a layout on the 's . For a that does not have a , a layout ignores the group itself but includes the group's members as if the group did not exist. If is true for a layout, this does not call its method.
The layout ignores invisible elements. A or is included in a layout only if returns true.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.GridLayout
member.summary: This simple layout places all of the nodes in a grid-like arrangement, ordered, and wrapping as needed.

remarks.para: By default this layout will sort all of the nodes alphabetically (ignoring case) and position them left-to-right until they don't fit in the current row, at which time it starts a new row. There is a uniform cell size equal to the maximum node width (plus spacing width) and the maximum node height (plus spacing height). At least one node is placed in each row, even if the node by itself is wider than the wrapping width. The wrapping width is given by the width in model coordinates of the diagram's panel's viewport width.

You can specify values for the Width and/or Height. If a node is wider than the cell size, it spans more than one cell in the row. You can also specify a value for the , which will be used instead of the diagram's viewport width.
This layout is sufficiently simple that it does not use a .

Although this class inherits from FrameworkElement in order to support data binding, it is not really a FrameworkElement or UIElement! Please ignore all of the properties, methods, and events defined by FrameworkElement and UIElement.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.GridLayout.CellSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum node size by which each node is positioned in the grid.
member.value: The default value is NaN x NaN. The units are in model coordinates. When the width is Double.NaN, the uses the maximum of all node widths plus the width. When the height is Double.NaN, the uses the maximum of all node heights, plus the height.
member.remarks: When the cell size is smaller than a node, the node will occupy more than one cell. This allows nodes to be positioned closer to each other, but then variations in node sizes may cause them not to be aligned in perfect rows or columns.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout
member.summary: ForceDirected provides an auto-layout algorithm for graphs which utilizes a force-directed method.

remarks.para: The graph is viewed as a system of bodies with forces acting between the bodies. The algorithm seeks a configuration of the bodies with locally minimal energy, i.e., a position such that the sum of the forces on each body is zero.

Although this class inherits from FrameworkElement in order to support data binding, it is not really a FrameworkElement or UIElement! Please ignore all of the properties, methods, and events defined by FrameworkElement and UIElement.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.DoLayout(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Northwoods.GoXam.Node},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Northwoods.GoXam.Link})
member.summary: Performs force-directed auto-layout.
member.remarks: This method can be overridden to customize the layout algorithm, but care should be taken to ensure that each node and link in the input network are properly initialized and terminated. If is null, this calls to allocate and initialize a with the graph that is in the . After all of the computations are completed, this calls in order to commit the positions of all of the nodes. No undo/redo transaction is started or finished by this method.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.NeedsClusterLayout
member.summary: Determines whether a clustering layout should be done before the regular force-directed layout.

remarks.para: A clustering layout is useful when the graph is somewhat tree-like.

For compatibility with older behavior, this does not examine the graph structure, but only at the positions of the nodes. By default this looks at the first few nodes in the . If several of their intersect, this will return true; otherwise this will return false. Hence for a network whose nodes are already "spread out", no cluster layout will occur.

member.summary: Gets or sets the space between which will position the connected graphs that together compose the network.
member.value: This defaults to the Size(100, 100).
member.remarks: These distances are used during a clustered layout; afterwards the normal force-directed layout will likely cause the size of any space between connected graphs to change, perhaps considerably.

member.value: By default this is false -- the is ignored. When this is true, nodes are moved even though was true.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.ArrangeConnectedGraphs(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator{Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedNetwork},Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedNetwork)
member.summary: During a clustered layout, position each separate graph network so that they do not overlap each other.
member.param: an IEnumerator iterating over a number of , each containing a connected graph; this is the result of calling
a containing only unconnected individual nodes

remarks.para: There may be separate component graphs (without any links between them) within the original network. The enumerator will iterate over a number of s, each containing a connected (sub)graph. If the original network is connected, i.e. if there is at least one path of undirected links from each node in the original to every other node, then there will be only a single for the enumerator, and the network will be empty.
This method places each separately-laid-out graph in different non-overlapping locations. By default this ignores , because it may move "fixed" nodes to ensure disconnected subgraphs do not overlap.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.AddComments(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedVertex)
member.summary: Find associated objects to be positioned along with the ..
member.remarks: This method is called for each node in the network, when is true. The standard behavior is to look for objects whose category is "Comment" and that refer to the force-directed vertex's . You may want to override this method in order to customize how any associated objects are found and how a new and are added to the network to represent the balloon comment. This method sets the new node's to the value of , and sets the new link's to the value of .

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.GetNodeDistance(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedVertex,Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedVertex)
member.summary: Returns the distance between two nodes. The default implementation considers the shortest distance between the two nodes. If the nodes correspond to top-level Go objects, the width and height of the GoObject is factored into the distance between the nodes. If the nodes do not correspond to top-level Go objects, then the nodes implicitly have a width and height of zero, and the distance is calculated.
member.returns: Returns the distance between two nodes.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.SpringStiffness(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedEdge)
member.summary: Returns the stiffness of the spring representing the ForceDirectedEdge link. The to and from nodes of link L are acted upon by a force of magnitude SpringStiffness(L) * (GetNodeDistance(L.from, L.to) - SpringLength(L)).
member.returns: Returns the stiffness of the spring representing link, normally the value of , unless the value of had already been set, in which case it just returns that value.
member.remarks: Very small positive numbers are normal. Values larger than that tend to cause "jittery" behavior that makes it hard or impossible to settle down, since no stable state can be found.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.SpringLength(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedEdge)
member.summary: Returns the length of the spring representing the ForceDirectedEdge link. The to and from nodes of a link L are acted upon by a force of magnitude SpringStiffness(L) * (GetNodeDistance(L.from, L.to) - SpringLength(L)).
member.returns: Returns the length of the spring representing link, normally the value of , unless the value of had already been set, in which case it just returns that value.
member.remarks: If your nodes are large, you may need to increase this value, so that many nodes aren't forced to be packed in close to each other.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.ElectricalCharge(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedVertex)
member.summary: Returns the charge of the point representing the ForceDirectedVertex node. A node L and a node V are acted upon by a force of magnitude (ElectricalCharge(L) * ElectricalCharge(V)) / (GetNodeDistance(L,V) * GetNodeDistance(L,V)). A node L is acted upon by forces in the X and Y directions of magnitude ElectricalFieldX(L.position) * ElectricalCharge(L) and ElectricalFieldY(L.position) * ElectricalCharge(L).
member.returns: Returns the charge of the node, normally the value of , unless the value of had already been set, in which case it just returns that value.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.ElectricalFieldX(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Returns the electrical field in the X direction acting on a node at the logical point Point xy. A node L is acted upon by a force in the X direction of magnitude ElectricalFieldX(L.position) * ElectricalCharge(L).
member.returns: Returns the electrical field in the X direction, normally zero

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.ElectricalFieldY(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Returns the electrical field in the Y direction acting on a node at the logical point Point xy. A node L is acted upon by a force in the Y direction of magnitude ElectricalFieldY(L.position) * ElectricalCharge(L).
member.returns: Returns the electrical field in the Y direction, normally zero

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.GravitationalMass(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedVertex)
member.summary: The function GravitationalMass returns the mass of the point representing the ForceDirectedVertex node. A node L is acted upon by forces in the X and Y directions of magnitude GravitationalFieldX(L.position) * GravitationalMass(L) and GravitationalFieldY(L.position) * GravitationalMass(L).
member.returns: Returns the mass of node, normally the value of , unless the value of had already been set, in which case it just returns that value.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.GravitationalFieldX(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: The function GravitationalFieldX returns the gravitational field in the X direction acting on a node at the logical point Point xy. A node L is acted upon by a force in the X direction of magnitude GravitationalFieldX(L.position) * GravitationalMass(L).
member.returns: Returns the gravitational field in the X direction at point xy, normally zero.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.ForceDirectedLayout.GravitationalFieldY(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: The function GravitationalFieldY returns the gravitational field in the Y direction acting on a node at the logical point Point xy. A node L is acted upon by a force in the Y direction of magnitude GravitationalFieldY(L.position) * GravitationalMass(L).
member.returns: Returns the gravitational field in the Y direction at point xy, normally zero

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout
member.summary: LayeredDigraph provides an auto-layout for layered drawings of directed graphs.

remarks.para: The method uses a hierarchical approach for creating drawings of digraphs with nodes arranged in layers. The layout algorithm consists of four-major steps: Cycle Removal, Layer Assignment, Crossing Reduction, and Straightening and Packing.

Although this class inherits from FrameworkElement in order to support data binding, it is not really a FrameworkElement or UIElement! Please ignore all of the properties, methods, and events defined by FrameworkElement and UIElement.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.LinkMinLength(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphEdge)
member.summary: The function LinkMinLength returns the minimum length of the link represented by the LayeredDigraphLink link. The default implementation gives multi-links a minimum length of 2, and all other links a minimum length of 1. This function can be overridden to provide "fine-tuning" of the layout.
member.returns: Returns the minimum length of the link represented by link

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.LinkLengthWeight(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphEdge)
member.summary: The function LinkLengthWeight returns the weight of the link represented by the LayeredDigraphLink link. This weight is used by OptimalLinkLengthLayering to minimize weighted link lengths. The default implementation gives all links a length weight of 1. This function can be overridden to provide "fine-tuning" of the layout.
member.returns: Returns the weight of the link represented by link

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.LinkStraightenWeight(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphEdge)
member.summary: The function LinkStraightenWeight returns the weight of the link represented by the LayeredDigraphLink link. This weight is used by the straightening methods to give priority straightening to those links with higher weights. The default implementation gives links between two "real" nodes a weight of 1, links between a "real" node and an "artifical" node a weight of 4, and links between two "artificial" nodes a weight of 8. This function can be overridden to provide "fine-tuning" of the layout.
member.returns: Returns the weight of the link represented by link

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.NodeMinLayerSpace(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphVertex,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function returns the minimum space reserved for this node from the center point for the "depth" of the layer that it is in.
member.param: whether to return the distance from the to the , or from the Center to the bottom or right side of the
member.returns: Returns the minimum space reserved above and below this node, in document coordinates
member.remarks: The default implementation returns 0 for nodes that do not correspond to top-level Go objects. For nodes that do correspond to top-level Go objects, the layer space is determined by the width or height of the object depending on the . By default this adds 10 to the space, to account for port end segment lengths.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.NodeMinColumnSpace(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphVertex,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The function NodeMinColumnSpace returns the minimum space reserved to either side of this node. The default implementation returns 0 for nodes that do not correspond to top-level Go objects. For nodes that do correspond to top-level Go objects, the column space is determined by the width and height of the object divided by the . Note: all sub-classes that override this method should ensure that nodes that do not correspond to top-level Go objects have a minimum column space of 0. This function can be overridden to provide "fine-tuning" of the layout.
member.param: whether to return the distance from the to the , or from the Center to the bottom or right side of the
member.returns: Returns the minimum space reserved to either side of the center of this node, in units of

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.CrossingMatrix(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Computes the crossing matrix between the unfixedLayer and its adjacent layers. The direction argument indicates which adjacent layers should be taken into consideration when computing the crossing matrix:
direction == 0 -- use unfixedLayer - 1 and unfixedLayer + 1 direction > 0 -- use unfixedLayer - 1 (sweeping away from layer 0) direction < 0 -- use unfixedLayer + 1 (sweeping towards layer 0)
The resulting integer array can be used as follows: if index1 and index2 are the indices corresponding to two nodes on the unfixedLayer and crossmat is the crossing matrix, then crossmat[index1 * indices[unfixedLayer] + index2] is the number of crossing that occur if the node corresponding to index1 is placed to the left of the node corresponding to index2. If index1 == index2, then crossmat[index1 * indices[unfixedLayer] + index2] is the number of crossings between links to and from the node corresponding to index1.
member.returns: Returns the crossing matrix

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.CountCrossings
member.summary: Returns the total number of crossings in the network. Internal method used by .
member.returns: Returns the total number of crossings in the network.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.Bends(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Computes the bends between the unfixedLayer and its adjacent layers. The "bend" between a node U and a node V connected by a link L is calcluated by abs((U.column + L.portFromColOffset) - (V.column + L.portToColOffset)) The "weighted bend" between a node U and a node V connected by link L is calculated by abs((U.column + L.portFromColOffset) - (V.column + L.portToColOffset)) * LinkStraightenWeight(L) The LinkStraightenWeight attempts to give higher priority to links between "artificial" nodes; i.e., long links in the final layout will be straighter. The direction argument indicates which adjacent layers should be taken into consideration when computing the crossing matrix: direction == 0 -- use unfixedLayer - 1 and unfixedLayer + 1 direction > 0 -- use unfixedLayer - 1 (sweeping away from layer 0) direction < 0 -- use unfixedLayer + 1 (sweepeing towards layer 0)
member.returns: Returns the bends between the unfixedLayer and its adjacent layers.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.CountBends(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the total number of bends in the network. The "bend" between a node U and a node V connected by a link L is calcluated by abs((U.column + L.portFromColOffset) - (V.column + L.portToColOffset)) The "weighted bend" between a node U and a node V connected by link L is calculated by abs((U.column + L.portFromColOffset) - (V.column + L.portToColOffset)) * LinkStraightenWeight(L) The LinkStraightenWeight attempts to give higher priority to links between "artificial" nodes; i.e., long links in the final layout will be straighter.
member.returns: Returns the total number of bends in the network.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.Normalize
member.summary: Adjusts the columns of all nodes such that the leftmost column will be column 0 and maxColumn is updated appropriately.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.Barycenters(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the array of barycenters (average) columns for the nodes in the unfixedLayer based on the columns of predecessors (direction < 0), successors (direction > 0), or both predecessors and successors (direction == 0) Elements without a defined barycenter will have an entry of -1.
member.returns: Returns the array of barycenters (average) columns for the nodes in the unfixedLayer

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.Medians(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the array of median columns for the nodes in the unfixedLayer based on the columns of predecessors (direction < 0), successors (direction > 0), or both predecessors and successors (direction == 0). Elements without a defined median will have an entry of -1.
member.returns: Returns the array of median columns for the nodes in the unfixedLayer

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.TightComponentUnset(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphVertex,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uses a depth first search algorithm to set the component of all nodes in a component. Tight** functions only set the component and recurse on nodes which are "tight", in the sense that the nodes are separated by a link which corresponds to the minumum link length of the link between the two nodes. **Unset functions only set the component and recurse on nodes whose component is currently set to the unset value. The forward and backward bools indicate the direction to use for a directed depth first search from node.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.ComponentUnset(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphVertex,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uses a depth first search algorithm to set the component of all nodes in a component. **Unset functions only set the component and recurse on nodes whose component is currently set to the unset value. The forward and backward bools indicate the direction to use for a directed depth first search from node.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.RemoveCycles
member.summary: Removes cycles from the input network by reversing some number of links.
member.remarks: By default this just calls or , as appropriate given the value of .

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.GreedyCycleRemoval
member.summary: Removes cycles from the input network using a Greedy-Cycle-Removal algorithm. The idea is to induce an order on all nodes in the network (U1, U2, U3, ..., Uk) such that for the majority of links L = (Ui, Uj) it is true that i < j. All links L = (Ui, Uj) such that i > j are reversed.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.GreedyCycleRemovalFindNode(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphNetwork)
member.summary: Finds a valid node in the network. Returns null if no valid node exists. Used by GreedyCycleRemoval.
member.returns: Returns a valid node in the network or null if no valid nodes exist

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.GreedyCycleRemovalFindSink(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphNetwork)
member.summary: Finds a sink node in the network. A node is considered a sink node if it is valid and all of its predecessors are invalid. A valid node with no predecessors is vacously a sink. Returns null if no valid sink node exists. Used by GreedyCycleRemoval.
member.returns: Returns a sink node in the network, or null if no valid sink node exists

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.GreedyCycleRemovalFindSource(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphNetwork)
member.summary: Finds a source node in the network. A node is considered a sink node if it is valid and all of its successors are invalid. A valid node with no successors is vacously a source. Returns null if no valid source node exists. Used by GreedyCycleRemoval.
member.returns: Returns a source node in the network or null if no sources exist

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.GreedyCycleRemovalFindNodeMaxDegDiff(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphNetwork)
member.summary: Finds a valid node in the network that maximizes outdeg - indeg. The degree difference is computed using valid successors and predecessors. Returns null if no valid node exists. Used by GreedyCycleRemoval.
member.returns: Returns a valid node in the network that maximized outdeg-indeg or null if no valid node exists

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.DepthFirstSearchCycleRemoval
member.summary: Removes cycles from the input network using a depth first search. A link not in the depth first forest is reversed if the from-node was discovered and finished by the depth first search after the to-node was discovered but before the to-node was finished.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.DepthFirstSearchCycleRemovalVisit(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphVertex)
member.summary: Peforms the recursive step of the depth first search on node. Updates the discover and finish time of node. Updates the forest flag of followed links.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.LongestPathSinkLayering
member.summary: Assigns every node in the input network to a layer. In addition to the requirements described in AssignLayers(), LongestPathSinkLayering ensures that every sink appears in layer 0 and every node is as close to a sink as possible.

member.summary: Computes the length of the longest path from node to a sink node and sets the layer of node to that length. Returns the length of the longest path from node to a sink node.
member.returns: Returns the length of the longest path from node to a sink node.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.LongestPathSourceLayering
member.summary: Assigns every node in the input network to a layer. In addition to the requirements described in , LongestPathSourceLayering ensures that every source appears in layer maxLayer and every node is as close to a source as possible.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.LongestPathSourceLayeringLength(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphVertex)
member.summary: Computes the length of the longest path from node to a source node and sets the layer of node to that length. Returns the length of the longest path from node to a source node.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.OptimalLinkLengthLayering
member.summary: Assigns every node in the input network to a layer. In addition to the requirements described in AssignLayers(), OptimalLinkLengthLayering ensures that nodes are set in layers to minimize the total weighted link length. Hence, OptimalLinkLengthLayering minimizes the sum (U.layer - V.layer) * LinkLengthWeight(L) over all links L = (U,V).
member.remarks: See also and

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.OptimalLinkLengthLayeringDepthFirstSearch(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphVertex)
member.summary: Peforms the depth first search of the network. After traversing all decendents, the node is "pull"-ed into the appropriate layer.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.OptimalLinkLengthLayeringPull(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphVertex)
member.summary: Attempts to move node and it's tight component to a higher layer.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.OptimalLinkLengthLayeringPush(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphVertex)
member.summary: Attempts to move node and it's tight component to a lower layer.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.MakeProper
member.summary: Converts the input network into a proper digraph; i.e., artificial nodes and links are introduced into the network such that every link is between nodes in adjacent layers. This has the effect of breaking up long links into a sequence of artificial nodes.
member.remarks: This method must not change the layer of any existing node, nor add or remove any layers.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.InitializeIndices
member.summary: Assigns every node in the input network an index number, such that nodes in the same layer will be labeled with consecutive indices in left to right order. All consecutive layout operations will preserve or update the indices. In addition, the indices array is initialized such that indices[layer] indicates the number of nodes in the layer. Finally, the variables minIndexLayer and maxIndexLayer record the layers that correspond to the minimum and maximum nodes in a layer.
member.remarks: By default this will just call , , or , as appropriate given the value of . This method must not change the layer of any existing node, nor add or remove any layers.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.NaiveInitializeIndices
member.summary: Assigns every node in the input network an index number, such that nodes in the same layer will be labeled with consecutive indices in left to right order. Uses a naive implementation that assigns indices to nodes as they are encountered in a sweep of the network. Because of the way networks are stored, this has the effect of initialy placing all "artificial" nodes to the right of all "real" nodes.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.DepthFirstOutInitializeIndices
member.summary: Assigns every node in the input network an index number, such that nodes in the same layer will be labeled with consecutive indices in left to right order. Uses a depth first "outward" (i.e., following links from "from-node" to "to-node") traversal of the network, assigning indices to nodes as they are discovered.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.DepthFirstOutInitializeIndicesVisit(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphVertex)
member.summary: Assigns node the appropriate index and updates the indices array. Implements the recursive portion of a depth first search.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.DepthFirstInInitializeIndices
member.summary: Assigns every node in the input network an index number, such that nodes in the same layer will be labeled with consecutive indices in left to right order. Uses a depth first "inward" (i.e., following links from "to-node" to "from-node") traversal of the network, assigning indices to nodes as they are discovered.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.DepthFirstInInitializeIndicesVisit(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphVertex)
member.summary: Assigns node the appropriate index and updates the indices array. Implements the recursive portion of a depth first search.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.InitializeColumns
member.summary: Assigns every node in the input network a column number, such that nodes in the same layer will be labeled with increasing indices in left to right order.
member.remarks: In addition, a node U is assigned to a column such that 2 * MinColumnSpace(U) + 1 columns are "allocated" to node U, and no two nodes have overlapping "allocations" of columns. All consecutive layout operations will preserve or update the columns. This method can be overridden to customize the layout algorithm. This method must not change the layer of any existing node, nor add or remove any layers.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.ReduceCrossings
member.summary: Reorders nodes within layers to reduce the total number of link crossings in the network. There are many, many possible implementations of this function. Basically, some iteration of MedianBarycenterCrossingReduction and AdjacentExchangeCrossingReductionBendStraighten sweeping back and forth over the layers is needed. The default implementation has performed favorably on a large number of networks, but other options are available.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.MedianBarycenterCrossingReduction(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reorders nodes within the unfixedLayer to reduce the number of link crossings between the unfixedLayer and its adjacent layers. The direction argument indicates which of the adjacent layers should be taken into consideration when reducing the number of crossings. direction == 0 -- use unfixedLayer - 1 and unfixedLayer + 1 direction > 0 -- use unfixedLayer - 1 (sweeping away from layer 0) direction < 0 -- use unfixedLayer + 1 (sweepeing towards layer 0) The idea is to calculate the median and barycenter for each node in the unfixedLayer, and to sort the nodes in the unfixedLayer by their median and barycenter values. Returns true if some change was made to the layer.
member.returns: Returns true if some change was made to the layer and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.AdjacentExchangeCrossingReductionBendStraighten(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adjusts the columns of nodes within the unfixedLayer to simultaneously reduce the number of link crossings and the number of "bends" between the unfixedLayer and its adjacent layers between the unfixedLayer and its adjacent layers. The directionCR argument indicates which of the adjacent layers should be taken into consideration when reducing the number of link crossings.
direction == 0 -- use unfixedLayer - 1 and unfixedLayer + 1 direction > 0 -- use unfixedLayer - 1 (sweeping away from layer 0) direction < 0 -- use unfixedLayer + 1 (sweepeing towards layer 0)
The directionBS argument indicates which of the adjacent layers should be taken into consideration when reducing the number of bends.
direction == 0 -- use unfixedLayer - 1 and unfixedLayer + 1 direction > 0 -- use unfixedLayer - 1 (sweeping away from layer 0) direction < 0 -- use unfixedLayer + 1 (sweepeing towards layer 0)
The "weighted bend" between a node U and a node V connected by link L is calculated by abs((U.column + L.portFromColOffset) - (V.column + L.portToColOffset)) * LinkStraightenWeight(L) The LinkStraightenWeight attempts to give higher priority to links between "artificial" nodes; i.e., long links in the final layout will be straighter. The idea is to use a bubble-sort technique to exchange adjacent nodes whenever doing so reduces the number of link crossings or the number of bends. This function is used in both crossing reduction and bend straightening. Returns true if some change was made to the layer.
member.param: the layer to be reordered
indicates which adjacent layers should be taken into consideration when calculating the crossing matrix
indicates whether or not to reorder to nodes to straighten links
indicates which adjacent layers should be taken into consideration when calculating the bends of a link
member.returns: Returns true if some change was made to the layer and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.StraightenAndPack
member.summary: Adjusts the columns of nodes in the network to produce a layout which reduces the number of bends and is tightly packed.
member.remarks: The behavior is controlled by the .

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.BendStraighten(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adjusts the columns of nodes within the unfixedLayer to reduce the number of "bends" between the unfixedLayer and its adjacent layers. The direction argument indicates which of the adjacent layers should be taken into consideration when reducing the number of bends. The "weighted bend" between a node U and a node V connected by link L is calculated by abs((U.column + L.portFromColOffset) - (V.column + L.portToColOffset)) * LinkStraightenWeight(L) The LinkStraightenWeight attempts to give higher priority to links between "artificial" nodes; i.e., long links in the final layout will be straighter. The idea is to iterate the ShiftBendStraighten and adjacentExchangeBendStraighten methods until no improvements are made.
member.returns: Returns true if an improvement was made.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.ShiftBendStraighten(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adjusts the columns of nodes within the unfixedLayer to reduce the number of "bends" between the unfixedLayer and its adjacent layers. The direction argument indicates which of the adjacent layers should be taken into consideration when reducing the number of bends. The "weighted bend" between a node U and a node V connected by link L is calculated by abs((U.column + L.portFromColOffset) - (V.column + L.portToColOffset)) * LinkStraightenWeight(L) The LinkStraightenWeight attempts to give higher priority to links between "artificial" nodes; i.e., long links in the final layout will be straighter. The idea is shift nodes to the left and to the right to reduce the bends ensuring that no two nodes have overlapping "allocations" of columns. Return true if some change was made to the layer.
member.returns: Return true if some change was made to the layer and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.MedianStraighten(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adjusts the columns of nodes within the unfixedLayer in order to move nodes towards their median columns. The direction argument indicates which of the adjacent layers should be taken into consideration when computing the median column. The idea is shift nodes to the left and to the right to move nodes towards their median columns, ensuring that no two nodes have overlapping "allocations" of columns. Returns true if some change was made to the layer.
member.returns: Returns true if some change was made to the layer and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.Pack
member.summary: Adjusts the columns of nodes in the network to produce a layout which is tightly packed. The idea is that columns which are "un-allocated" through all layers can be eliminated and the nodes can be shifted into that space.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.PackAux(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to remove the argument column by shifting columns into from the argument direction. direction > 0 -- columns > argument column are shifted direction < 0 -- columns < argument column are shifted Returns true if the argument column was removed.
member.returns: Returns true if the argument column was removed and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.TightPack
member.summary: Adjusts the columns of nodes in the network to produce a layout which is tightly packed. The idea is that two adjacent columns can be "merged" if each layer has at most one of the two columns "allocated" to a node.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.TightPackAux(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to augment the argument column by merging columns into from the argument direction. direction > 0 -- columns > the argument column are shifted direction < 0 -- columns < the argument column are shifted Returns true if the argument column was changed.
member.returns: Returns true if the argument column was changed and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.ComponentPack(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adjusts the columns of nodes in the network to produce a layout which is tightly packed. The idea is that the network can be fragmented from a given column in the following way: all nodes "behind" the column are placed into a single component, and the remainder of the network is divided into connected components. Each of these new components can be examined, and those that can be merged with the given column do so.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.ComponentPackAux(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to augment the argument column by merging components into from the argument direction. direction > 0 -- columns > the argument column are shifted direction < 0 -- columns < the argument column are shifted Returns true if the argument column was changed.
member.returns: Returns true if the argument column was changed and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.LayeredDigraphLayout.LayoutNodesAndLinks

member.remarks: One reason to override this method would be to take advantage of added functionality of sub-classes of Link, for example, a sub-class that tracked bend points and allowed them to be repositioned by the application. See also and .

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.WalkTree(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex)
member.summary: Traverse the and assign the , , and properties.
member.remarks: This method should walk the tree recursively. The standard implementation gracefully handles shared nodes, including cyclical references. However, there can only be one per node. If a node is declared to be the child of multiple nodes, it is not guaranteed which node wins as the parent node. If any of the children of this node are in the collection, they are removed from that collection.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.InitializeTreeVertexValues(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex)
member.summary: Assign initial property values for a .

remarks.para: The values may be inherited, so this method is called while propagating values from the root nodes. This method should not walk the tree, since it is called for each in a depth-first manner starting at a root.

You probably do not need to override this method, but if you do you should call first either the base method or , since they assign most of the property values used to influence the layout. Informational properties such as and will not yet have been initialized by the time this method is called. It is more common to override in order to modify a property or two to customize the layout at that node.
When the is , this will modify the appropriately depending on which side of the bus the vertex is on.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.AssignTreeVertexValues(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex)
member.summary: Assign final property values for a .

remarks.para: This method is commonly overidden in order to provide tree layout properties for particular nodes. This method is called after values have been inherited from other s, so you can examine and modify the values of related tree nodes.
However, when is , will be called before this method is called. In that case changing the or properties in this method will have no effect.
This method should not walk the tree, since it is called for each in a depth-first manner starting at a root.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.SortTreeVertexChildren(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex)
member.summary: Sort the of a node.

remarks.para: This method should not walk the tree, since it is called for each in a depth-first manner starting at a root. Normally this is called after all of the vertexes have had their values set by .

However, if is , this will be called before . The "BusBranching" alignment depends on inheriting the , which in turn depends on the sort order, hence sorting must be performed first. The difference is that when "BusBranching" the initialization pass has not yet finished, so informational properties have not yet been computed when this method is called.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.AddComments(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex)
member.summary: Find associated objects to be positioned along with the ..
member.remarks: This looks for visible s whose category is "Comment" and that refer to the tree vertex's . You may want to override this method in order to customize how any associated objects are found and how the node's are set to reserve space for those associated objects. This method should not walk the tree, since it is called for each in an indeterminate order.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.LayoutComments(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex)
member.summary: Position any around the vertex.
member.remarks: This method should not walk the tree, since it is called for each in an indeterminate order.

member.summary: Recursively lay out a subtree starting with the given parent node.
member.remarks: This method should walk the tree recursively.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.ComputeBusNodeSpacing(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex)
member.summary: Get the amount of space to insert between a child vertex and its parent spine when the parent's is Bus or BusBranching.
member.returns: By default this returns the parent's ; a small value may result in unpleasant routing of links, a negative value may cause node overlaps
member.remarks: This function is called on each child vertex to determine the initial distance of a child vertex from the spine that connects to its parent vertex. This function is not called on the last odd child, because that vertex is place at the end of the spine rather than to either side.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.ComputeBusLastRowSpacing(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex,System.Double)
member.summary: Get the amount of space to leave between the sibling child vertexes and this last odd vertex when the parent's is Bus or BusBranching.
member.param: the length of the central line (spine) separating the two sides, so far, excluding the initial that extends from the parent's spine
member.returns: By default this returns the parent's ; a negative value may cause node overlaps
member.remarks: This function is called only when there is an odd number of child vertexes and at least 3. This function is not called when the parent vertex only has one child. In that case there is no spine separating two columns of child vertexes.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.SetPortSpots(Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex)
member.summary: Assign port spots for single-port nodes, if or is true, according to the value of or .
member.remarks: This iterates over all of the s in the network, finds the corresponding , and assigns their FromSpot and/or ToSpot property if the and/or properties are true, and if the port's node only has a single port. The spot values are given by and respectively, unless the value is . In the latter case the actual spot is determined by the of the parent node (the ). For example, when the angle is zero, the tree grows deeper toward the right. So the FromSpot will be set to Spot.MiddleRight, and the ToSpot will be set to Spot.MiddleLeft.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.LayerSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between a parent node and its children.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.LayerSpacingParentOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets the fraction of the node's depth for which the children's layer starts overlapped with the parent's layer.
member.value: The default value is 0.0 -- there is overlap between layers only if is negative. A value of 1.0 and a zero will cause child nodes to completely overlap the parent.

remarks.para: A value greater than zero may still cause overlap between layers, unless the value of is large enough. A value of zero might still allow overlap between layers, if is negative.
This sets the 's property of the same name.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.BreadthLimitProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.BreadthLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a limit on how broad a tree should be.

remarks.para: This property is just a suggested constraint on how broadly the tree will be laid out. When there isn't enough breadth for all of the children of a node, the children are placed in as many rows as needed to try to stay within the given breadth limit. If the value is too small, since this layout algorithm does not modify the size or shape of any node, the nodes will just be laid out in a line, one per row, and the breadth is determined by the broadest node. The distance between rows is specified by . To make room for the links that go around earlier rows to get to later rows, when the alignment is not a "center" alignment, the property specifies that space at the start of each row.
This sets the 's property of the same name.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeLayout.RowSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between rows of children.
member.value: The default value is 25.

remarks.para: This property is only used when there is more than one row of children for a given parent node. determines the distance between the parent node and its first row of child nodes.
This sets the 's property of the same name.

member.value: The default value is 10. The value should be non-negative.

remarks.para: This is used to leave room for the links that connect a parent node with the child nodes that are in additional rows.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreePath
member.summary: This enumeration specifies how to build a tree from the .

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreePath.Default
member.summary: This value for uses the value of to determine whether edges go from the parent vertex to child vertexes or vice-versa.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreePath.Destination
member.summary: The children of a are its , the collection of connected .s. The tree roots are those s that have a zero .

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreePath.Source
member.summary: The children of a are its , the collection of connected .s. The tree roots are those s that have a zero .

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeSorting
member.summary: This enumeration specifies whether to sort the children of a node, and in what order to position them.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeSorting.Forwards
member.summary: Lay out each child in the order in which they were found.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeSorting.Reverse
member.summary: Lay out each child in reverse order from which they were found.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeSorting.Ascending
member.summary: Lay out each child according to the sort order given by .

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeSorting.Descending
member.summary: Lay out each child in reverse sort order given by .

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeAlignment
member.summary: This enumeration specifies how to position a parent relative to its children, or how to align children in a bus.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeAlignment.CenterSubtrees
member.summary: The parent is centered at the middle of the range of its child subtrees. When there is a breadth limit that causes there to be multiple rows, the links that extend from the parent to those children in rows past the first one may cross over the nodes that are in earlier rows.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeAlignment.CenterChildren
member.summary: The parent is centered at the middle of the range of its immediate child nodes. When there is a breadth limit that causes there to be multiple rows, the links that extend from the parent to those children in rows past the first one may cross over the nodes that are in earlier rows.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeAlignment.Start
member.summary: The parent is positioned near the first of its children.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeAlignment.End
member.summary: The parent is positioned near the last of its children.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeAlignment.Bus
member.summary: The children are positioned in a bus on both sides of an "aisle" where the links to them go, with the last odd child (if any) placed at the end of the aisle in the middle. The children, if they are themselves parents, continue at the same inherited angle; use if you want grandchildren to proceed growing in the different angle as determined by the side. A bus does not take BreadthLimit into account.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeAlignment.TopLeftBus
member.summary: The children are positioned in a bus, only on the top or left side of the parent, A bus does not take BreadthLimit into account.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeAlignment.BottomRightBus
member.summary: The children are positioned in a bus, only on the bottom or right side of the parent. A bus does not take BreadthLimit into account.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeAlignment.BusBranching
member.summary: Like with the children arranged on both sides of an "aisle" with any last odd child placed at the end of the aisle, but the children get an that depends on which side of the aisle they were placed. This only works well when the is .

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeCompaction
member.summary: This enumeration specifies how closely packed the children of a node should be.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeCompaction.None
member.summary: Only simple placement of children next to each other, as determined by their subtree breadth. For any node, there will not be another node at any depth occupying the same breadth position, unless there are multiple rows. In other words, if there is no breadth limit resulting in multiple rows, with this compaction mode it is as if every node were infinitely deep.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeCompaction.Block
member.summary: A simple fitting of subtrees. This mode produces more compact trees -- often nicer looking too. Nodes will not overlap each other, unless you have negative values for some of the spacing properties. However it is possible when the links are orthogonally styled that occasionally the subtrees will be placed so close together that some links may overlap the links or even the nodes of other subtrees.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeStyle
member.summary: This enumeration identifies the general style in which the nodes are laid out.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeStyle.Layered
member.summary: The normal tree style, where all of the children of each are lined up horizontally or vertically. Each gets its properties from its parent node. is used for all default property values; is ignored.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeStyle.LastParents
member.summary: Just like the standard layered style, except that the nodes with children but no grandchildren have alternate properties. Each gets its properties from its parent node. However, for those nodes whose is 1, in other words when it has children but no grandchildren, the properties are copied from the . If the tree only has two levels, the root node gets the .

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeStyle.Alternating
member.summary: Alternate layers of the tree have different properties, typically including the angle. Each gets its properties from its "grand-parent" node. The root nodes get their defaults from ; the immediate children of root nodes get their defaults from . Depending on the properties used, it is possible for some link routes to cross over nodes.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeStyle.RootOnly
member.summary: All of the nodes get the alternate properties, except the root node gets the default properties. The root node gets the properties, the root node's children get the properties, and all of the rest of the s get their properties from their parent node.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeArrangement
member.summary: This enumeration specifies how to position the resulting trees in the document.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeArrangement.Vertical
member.summary: Position each tree in a non-overlapping fashion by increasing Y coordinates, starting at the .

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeArrangement.Horizontal
member.summary: Position each tree in a non-overlapping fashion by increasing X coordinates, starting at the .

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeArrangement.FixedRoots
member.summary: Do not move each root node, but position all of their descendents relative to their root.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeNetwork
member.summary: This provides an abstract view of a as a network (graph) of nodes and directed links. These nodes and links correspond to s provided in the . This class provides a framework for manipulating the state of nodes and links without modifying the structure of the original document.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeNetwork.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an empty network.
member.remarks: Use this default constructor to create an empty network. Call to automatically add network nodes and links, or call and explicitly to have more detailed control over the exact graph that is laid out.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeEdge
member.summary: Holds auto-layout specific link data.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeEdge.CommitPosition
member.summary: Commits the position of the link to the corresponding Link.
member.remarks: This routes the Link's Route.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeEdge.RelativePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets a point, relative to the parent node, that may be useful in routing this link.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex
member.summary: Holds auto-layout specific node data.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.Initialized
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this node has been initialized as part of .

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the logical parent for this node.
member.remarks: This structural property is computed in . You probably should not be setting this property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.Children
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of logical children for this node.
member.remarks: This structural property is computed in . You probably should not be setting this property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.ChildrenCount
member.summary: Gets the number of immediate children that this node has.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.Level
member.summary: Gets the number of single-parent ancestors this node has.
member.remarks: This could also be interpreted as which layer this node is in. A root node will have a value of zero. This informational property is computed in . You probably should not be setting this property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.DescendentCount
member.summary: Gets the number of descendents this node has.
member.remarks: For a leaf node, this will be zero. This informational property is computed as part of the pass. You probably should not be setting this property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.MaxChildrenCount
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of children of any descendent of this node.
member.remarks: For a leaf node, this will be zero. This informational property is computed as part of the pass. You probably should not be setting this property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.MaxGenerationCount
member.summary: Gets the maximum depth of the subtrees below this node.
member.remarks: For a leaf node, this will be zero. This informational property is computed as part of the pass. You probably should not be setting this property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.RelativePosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of this node relative to its parent node.
member.remarks: This informational property is computed by . You probably should not be setting this property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.SubtreeSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the subtree (including all descendents) parented by this node.
member.remarks: This informational property is computed by . Of course if there are no children, this is just the same as . You probably should not be setting this property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.SubtreeOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset of this parent node relative to its whole subtree.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.Angle
member.summary: Gets or sets the actual absolute angle at which this node should grow.

member.remarks: This inherited property is initialized in the method. By default this is the same as the of the parent . However, after the initial propagation of property values, perhaps in an override of , you could just set this property to specify the angle at which this node grows it subtrees.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.NodeIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance the first child should be indented.
member.value: The default value is zero. The value should be non-negative.
member.remarks: This inherited property is initialized in the method. This property is only sensible when the is or .

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.NodeIndentPastParent
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the first child should be indented past the parent node's breadth.
member.value: The default value is 0.0 -- the only start or end spacing is provided by .
member.remarks: Values must range from 0.0 to 1.0, where 1.0 means the full breadth of this node. This inherited property is initialized in the method. This property is only sensible when the is or .

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.NodeSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between child nodes.
member.value: The default value is 20. A negative value causes sibling nodes to overlap.
member.remarks: This inherited property is initialized in the method.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.LayerSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance there should be between this node and its layer of children.
member.value: The default value is 50. Negative values may cause children to overlap with the parent.
member.remarks: This inherited property is initialized in the method.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.LayerSpacingParentOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets the fraction of this node's depth that may overlap with the children's layer.
member.value: Values must range from 0.0 to 1.0, where 1.0 means the full depth of this node. The default value is 0.0 -- there is overlap only if is negative.
member.remarks: When this value is greater than 0.0, there might not be overlap if is larger than the depth of this node times this fraction. Even when this value is 0.0, there may be overlap when is negative. This inherited property is initialized in the method.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.Compaction
member.summary: Gets or sets how the children of this node should be packed together.
member.value: The default value is .
member.remarks: This inherited property is initialized in the method.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.BreadthLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets how broad a node and its descendents should be.
member.value: By default this is zero. A value of zero imposes no limit; a positive value will specify a limit for the total width of this subtree.
member.remarks: This inherited property is initialized in the method.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.RowSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between rows within one layer, all sharing the same parent.
member.value: The default value is 25. Negative values may cause nodes to overlap.
member.remarks: This inherited property is initialized in the method.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.RowIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance the first child of each row should be indented.
member.value: The default value is 10. The value should be non-negative.
member.remarks: This inherited property is initialized in the method. This property is only used when the is positive, and some initial space needs to be reserved in each row of nodes for the links that are routed around those rows.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.CommentSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the space to leave between consecutive comments.
member.value: The default value is 10. Negative values may cause comments to overlap.
member.remarks: This inherited property is initialized in the method.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.TreeVertex.CommentMargin

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.CircularLayout.Radius
member.summary: Gets/sets the horizontal radius of the elliptical arrangement
member.value: The default value is NaN. NaN indicates that the will determing size of ring. If is also NaN, the effective spacing will be 6. If is a number, the effective radius will be > Radius if and only if the spacing between elements would otherwise be less than spacing. The specified value for will be ignored if ==. This property must always be positive or NaN.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.CircularLayout.AspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio of the arrangement's height to its width (1 for a circle, >1 for a vertically elongated ellipse).
member.value: This is 1 by default. The value must be a positive number.
member.remarks: Modifying this value changes the height, but keeps the width and the constant.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.CircularLayout.SweepAngleProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.CircularLayout.SweepAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the absolute angle (in degrees) between the first and last node.
member.value: The default value is 360. The value must be greater than zero and less than or equal to 360. If it is not in this range, it will be automatically set to 360.
member.remarks: Whether the arrangement is clockwise or counterclockwise does not depend on the sign of this value. The direction can be controlled by setting . If 360 is the specified value, the actual value will be less to keep the first and last elements from overlapping, and the spacing between the first and last nodes will be determined the same way as for all other adjacent nodes.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.CircularLayout.Spacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between nodes (if is NaN) or the minimum distance between nodes (if is a number).
member.value: The default value is 6. The value may be NaN.
member.remarks: If is NaN, there is no minimum spacing, allowing nodes to overlap, unless is NaN, in which case the effective spacing will be 6 to determine an effective radius. If is a number but isn't, the effective spacing will be Spacing, and this will determine the effective radius. If both and are numbers, the effective radius will be at least , but may be larger so that the minimum spacing between nodes is .

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Layout.DiagramLayout
member.summary: DiagramLayout is the base class for all of the predefined specific layout implementations.

remarks.para: This provides a rudimentary default layout that will position all of the nodes that have no position (i.e. the is NaN, NaN). Nodes that already have a position are ignored. The layout behavior may be improved in the future.
The will call to decide which s and s will be passed to . looks at this layout's and the part's to see if they match, among other criteria.

As changes occur to the diagram, such as the addition of a or the removal of a or the change in size of a , the method will be called. Depending on the kind of change and on the value of , the property may be set to false. At a later time, such as at the end of a transaction, the will call to make the layout valid again.

To implement your own custom layouts, you can inherit from either this class or from one of the other predefined layout classes, overriding the method. You can call the method to re-position a node, including whole groups, possibly with animation. Install the layout as the value of or .

Although this class inherits from FrameworkElement in order to support data binding, it is not really a FrameworkElement or UIElement! Please ignore all of the properties, methods, and events defined by FrameworkElement and UIElement.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.NodePanel
member.summary: This panel is useful for having a background shape as the primary object and positioning one or more child elements within that shape.

remarks.para: A NodePanel is typically used as the implementation of a 's DataTemplate when you want the node to basically be some shape (a "figure", but it can be any kind of UIElement) and you want to position and align additional elements within that primary shape. If you want elements such as text outside of that shape, we suggest you use a Panel such as StackPanel or Grid to arrange the node the way you want.

The first child element of the panel is treated as the main object. It can have two attached property values, NodePanel.Spot1 and NodePanel.Spot2, that denote the top-left and bottom-right corners of an area where the other child elements are placed. The default spot values will just cover the whole element. However, a NodeShape, with a NodeFigure attached property is frequently used as the first element of a NodePanel. Such shapes have predefined Spot1 and Spot2 values in addition to having particular geometries.
The layout will observe the FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment and VerticalAlignment properties of each child element after the first one.

As an example, here is the definition of a simple template that displays a resizable rounded rectangle surrounding some text:
<DataTemplate x:Key="ExampleNodeTemplate"> <go:NodePanel go:Node.Location="{Binding Path=Data.XY, Mode=TwoWay}" go:Node.SelectionElementName="Shape" go:Node.Resizable="True"> <go:NodeShape x:Name="Shape" go:NodePanel.Figure="RoundedRectangle" Width="50" Height="20" Stroke="Gray" StrokeThickness="1" Fill="LightYellow" /> <TextBlock Text="{Binding Path=Data.Name}" TextWrapping="Wrap" /> </go:NodePanel> </DataTemplate>
You must use the <go:NodeShape> element instead of a <Path> element.

member.remarks: If the child is narrower than the Spot1-Spot2 determined area of the first element, the child's FrameworkElement.HorizontalAlignment applies. Similarly, if the child is shorter than the Spot1-Spot2 determined area of the first element, the child's FrameworkElement.VerticalAlignment applies.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.NodePanelSizing
member.summary: Defines how this will resize its children.
member.remarks: In each scenario, the first child is treated as a background object in the panel and all children are placed within the rectangular area defined by its NodePanel.Spot1 and NodePanel.Spot2 properties. The observes the HorizontalAlignment and VerticalAlignment properties on the other children.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.NodePanelSizing.Fixed
member.summary: The takes the size of its first child. All other elements are placed within the bounds defined by the NodePanel.Spot1 and NodePanel.Spot2 properties of that first child.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.NodePanelSizing.Auto
member.summary: The is automatically sized to fit all of its children. Basically, the first child (presumably a convex shape) will surround the second child, which in simple nodes is typically a TextBlock, but could be a more complicated element. If the child is a TextBlock with text wrapping set to true, it will be appropriately wrapped so that all of its text is visible.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.SelectionHandle
member.summary: This Shape can be used only in the DataTemplate for an indicating that another part is selected.

remarks.para: A takes the shape of the that it adorns, but its Stroke, StrokeThickness, Fill, et al. must still be set. You should not set its Width or Height, because those will be determined by the size and shape of the adorned element.

A simple example definition:
<DataTemplate> <go:SelectionHandle Stroke="Red" StrokeThickness="2" /> </DataTemplate>
If a SelectionHandle is not the only element of the selection adornment template, it should be named as the for the whole adornment.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.ToolHandle
member.summary: This Shape can be used only in the DataTemplate for an used by s to allow the adorned part to be manipulated.

remarks.para: You should set its Stroke, StrokeThickness, Fill, et al. as you would for any Shape, as well as its Width and Height.

A ToolHandle is rectangular by default, but you can set or bind its attached property to get different figures. You can specify a limited number of figure shapes for these handles: (the default figure), , , , , , , , , ,

A simple example definition:
<DataTemplate> <go:SpotPanel> <go:ToolHandle go:SpotPanel.Spot="Center" go:NodePanel.Figure="Ellipse" Width="6" Height="6" Fill="Yellow" Stroke="Black" StrokeThickness="1" /> </go:SpotPanel> </DataTemplate>
You can have many tool handles in a single .

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Adornment
member.summary: An adornment is a special kind of that is associated with another part, the .

remarks.para: Adornments can be associated with a particular element in the adorned part -- that is the value of .

Adornments can be distinguished by their . This property can be an arbitrary string value determined by the code creating the adornment, typically a tool that wants to be able to tell various adornments apart from each other. Use the method to find an adornment for a part of a given category.
For example, adornments created by have the of "Selection". Those created by have a category of "Resize".
Adornments are always unbound parts -- but if the is bound to data, the adornment's data bindings can refer to the same data.
There cannot be any links connected to an adornment, nor can an adornment have members or be a member of a group.
An adornment cannot have its own adornments.

The template you use for a selection adornment will normally consist of a SelectionHandle, or for nodes a , which is treated specially within an Adornment, or for links a . Although this element is normally the root , if it is surrounded by a panel or container or decorator, you need to make sure that it is the for the Adornment by naming it and supplying that name as the .
The template you use for a tool adornment will normally consist of either a ToolHandle, or for nodes a containing ToolHandles, or for links a containing ToolHandles.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.NodeShape
member.summary: This Shape can be used in a as the background for text and/or other elements.

remarks.para: You will need to set the NodePanel.Figure attached property (see cref="NodePanel.SetFigure"/>) to give the shape a predefined geometry. The geometry of some figures can be customized by setting parameters (also attached properties).

In addition to setting the usual properties of the Shape such as Fill, Stroke, StrokeThickness, et al., remember to set the Width and Height, unless this shape is the first child of a with a other than , in which case the will size this shape appropriately.
The uses the NodePanel.Spot1 and NodePanel.Spot2 attached properties to control where in the shape the text element(s) should be placed.

A typical usage:
<DataTemplate x:Key="ExampleNodeTemplate"> <go:NodePanel go:Node.Location="{Binding Path=Data.XY, Mode=TwoWay}" go:Node.SelectionElementName="Shape" go:Node.Resizable="True"> <go:NodeShape x:Name="Shape" go:NodePanel.Figure="RoundedRectangle" Width="50" Height="20" Stroke="Gray" StrokeThickness="1" Fill="LightYellow" /> <TextBlock Text="{Binding Path=Data.Name}" TextWrapping="Wrap" /> </go:NodePanel> </DataTemplate>
You must use the <go:NodeShape> element instead of a <Path> element.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Overview
member.summary: The Overview control is a that tries to display all of the model shown by a different , with a rectangular box showing the viewport displayed by that other diagram.
member.remarks:
The Overview shows the nodes and links from the of the . You should set the property after both the Overview and the Diagram have been initialized:
this.Loaded += (s,e) => { myOverview.Observed = myDiagram; };
