member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.DiagramTool.DoMouseDown
member.summary: The diagram will call this method upon a mouse down event.
member.remarks: This is normally overridden for mouse-down tools; it is not called for mouse-move or mouse-up tools. However it may also be called when the tool is run in a modal fashion, when code explicitly sets the diagram's .

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.DiagramTool.DoMouseMove
member.summary: The diagram will call this method upon a mouse move event.
member.remarks: This is normally overridden for mouse-move tools; it is not called for mouse-up tools. However it may also be called when the tool is run in a modal fashion, when code explicitly sets the diagram's . An override of this method usually does nothing when is false.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.DiagramTool.DoMouseUp
member.summary: The diagram will call this method upon a mouse up event.

remarks.para: This is normally overridden for mouse-up tools. An override of this method usually does nothing when is false, except for calling .

Tools normally stop upon a mouse up, by calling . If you want to handle multiple mouse down-up gestures in one tool activation, you will need to override this method to only stop the tool when you want.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.DiagramTool.DoMouseWheel
member.summary: The diagram will call this method as the mouse wheel is rotated.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.DiagramTool.DoKeyDown(System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: The diagram will call this method upon a key down event.

remarks.para: By default this just calls if the key is the ESCAPE key.

This key event method isn't called because of the command mechanism. If you want this method to be called, override to call this.Diagram.CommandHandler.RemoveStandardBindings() and override to call this.Diagram.CommandHandler.AddStandardBindings().

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.DiagramTool.DoKeyUp(System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: The diagram will call this method upon a key up event.
member.remarks: This key event method isn't called due to the command mechanism.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.DiagramTool.StandardMouseWheel
member.summary: Implement the standard behavior for mouse wheel events.

remarks.para: If is true, turning the mouse wheel causes the diagram to scroll up or down. If is also true, the diagram scrolls left or right.
If is true and if is true, turning the mouse wheel changes the diagram's scale, zooming in or out while trying to keep the point in the model at the same point as the mouse.

member.name: M:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.DiagramTool.StandardMouseSelect
member.summary: Implement the standard behavior for selecting parts with the mouse, depending on the control and shift modifier keys.

remarks.para: Control-clicking on a part will select it if it wasn't already, and will deselect if it had been selected. Shift-clicking on a part will add it to the selection (if it isn't already). Otherwise, clicking on a part will select it (if it isn't already).
Note that there are restrictions on selection. For example, a part cannot be selected in this manner if is false, or if would be exceeded.
A left click in the background of the diagram with no modifier keys clears the selection.

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.WheelBehavior
member.summary: This enumeration controls the behavior of the mouse wheel by .

remarks.para: These enumerated values can be combined as flags. However, when conflicting flags are combined, the behavior is undetermined. Flags conflict when they specify different behaviors for the same combination of modifiers: Control or Shift or Alt (or no modifiers at all).
At the current time, the only conflicting flags are for unmodified mouse wheel events: or .

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.WheelBehavior.None
member.summary: When is "None", mouse wheel events are ignored.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.WheelBehavior.ScrollsVertically
member.summary: When there is no modifier, mouse wheel events scroll the diagram up and down.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.WheelBehavior.Zooms
member.summary: When there is no modifier, mouse wheel events zoom in and out.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.WheelBehavior.ControlZooms
member.summary: When there is only a Control key modifier, mouse wheel events zoom in and out.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.WheelBehavior.ShiftScrollsHorizontally
member.summary: When there is only a Shift key modifier, mouse wheel events scroll the diagram left and right.

member.name: F:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.WheelBehavior.Standard
member.summary: This combination of flags represents the default value for : , , and .

member.name: T:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.IDiagramTool
member.summary: This interface specifies the methods the diagram uses to control each tool and the methods used to handle the standard input events processed through the diagram.

remarks.para: All existing tools are actually subclasses of the abstract class , which implements this interface.

All uses of tools in use this interface, not the class . However, the class also has a property for each of the mode-less tools that the diagram might have, for convenience in replacing or removing those specific tools from the diagram.

member.name: P:Northwoods.GoXam.Tool.IDiagramTool.Active
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this tool is started and is actively doing something.
member.remarks: You can set this to true after your tool is started (i.e. when it is the and had been called), but when it is not yet in a state that it is actually "doing" something, because it is waiting for the right circumstances. This is typically only important when the tool is used in a modal fashion.
